sentence.Network_en: On a clear night scores of meteors streak the sky.
sentence.Network_cn: 在晴朗的夜晚,好几十颗流星划破长空.

sentence.Network_en: We should expect to see some meteors or shooting stars.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们可以期望看到一些陨星或流星.

sentence.Network_en: Meteors usually blaze for only a few seconds.
sentence.Network_cn: 流星往往只闪亮几秒钟.

PerfectNetExp.abs: Then out of the meteors came monsters , spreading destruction with torch and gas ., 然后从陨星上出来一些怪物 , 用火把和毒气四处破坏.

a handful of meteors can be seen each hour on any clear night , but this number spike significantly during a meteor shower .在晴朗的夜空，每小时都可以看到有少量流星划过，但是在出现流星雨的时候，流星的数量将会大幅度增加。
we lay down and looked at the sky and I saw the first time all these meteors .我们一起躺下，望著天空，我第一次看到流星群。

entry.def: A meteor is a piece of rock or metal that burns very brightly when it enters the earth's atmosphere from space.
